intro: Codonoprasum alpicola, commonly known as the alpine chervil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. It is often found at high altitudes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in many regions.
